Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.check

Class CommonGetters

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.naturalis.common.check.CommonGetters
  • public class CommonGetters
extends Object
    Defines various functions that can be used to retrieve a property of the argument. They are meant to be used as the first argument to the various has(...) methods of the Check class. Some functions, are not actually getters (no-arg methods called on the argument), but rather single-argument methods which get passed the argument.

    Each getter is already associated with the name of the property it exposes, so the combination of a getter from the CommonGetters class and a check from the CommonChecks class allows the underlying code to generate a full-blown error message. For example: 

     Check.that(stampCollection, "stampCollection").has(size(), gt(), 100);
 // Error message: "stampCollection.size() must be > 100 (was 22)"

    Most methods in this class return plain method references. None of them do a preliminary null-check on the argument. They rely upon being embedded within in chain of checks on a Check object, the first of which should be a not-null check.

    Author:
    Ayco Holleman
